intro: Taraxacum rhodobasis, commonly known as the redroot dandelion, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers and distinctive reddish-brown taproot. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this species thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. The plant is known for its ability to spread via wind-dispersed seeds, contributing to its widespread distribution. Its foliage is typically lance-shaped with a rough, hairy texture.
